questions.question: Give the definition of an even integer.
choices:
question: An integer $$n$$ is even if $$2n = k$$ for some integers $$k$$.
An integer $$n$$ is even if $$n = 2k+1$$ for some integer $$k$$.
An integer $$n$$ is even if $$n = 2k$$ for some integer $$k$$.
An integer $$n$$ is even if $$n = 2k+1$$ for all integer $$k$$.
questions.solution: An integer $$n$$ is even if $$n = 2k$$ for some integer $$k$$.

questions.question: Give the definition of an odd integer.
choices:
question: An integer $$n$$ is odd if $$n = 2k$$ for some integer $$k$$.
An integer $$n$$ is odd if $$2n + 1 = k + 1$$ for  integer $$n$$.
An integer $$n$$ is odd if $$n = 3k + 1$$ for some integer $$k$$.
An integer $$n$$ is odd if $$n$$ divides $$2k$$ for some integer $$k$$.
questions.solution: An integer $$n$$ is odd if $$n = 2k + 1$$ for some integer $$k$$.

questions.question: Give the definition of a rational number.
choices:
question: A number $$r$$ is rational if there exist two integers $$x$$ and $$y$$, where $$y$$ is nonzero, such that $$r = \frac{x}{y}.
A number $$r$$ is rational if there exist two integers $$x$$ and $$y$$, where $$y$$ is nonzero, such that $$r = \frac{y}{x}.
A number $$r$$ is rational if there exist two integers $$x$$ and $$y$$, where $$y$$ is zero, such that $$r = \frac{x}{y}.
A number $$r$$ is rational if there exist two integers $$x$$ and $$y$$, where $$y$$ is nonzero, such that $$r = \frac{x}{y}+3.
questions.solution: A number $$r$$ is rational if there exist two integers $$x$$ and $$y$$, where $$y$$ is nonzero, such that $$r = \frac{x}{y}.

questions.question: What does it mean for an integer x to divide another integer y?
choices:
question: $$x$$ divides $$y$$ if there exists an integer $$k$$ such that $$k = yx$$
$$x$$ divides $$y$$ if there exists an integer $$k$$ such that $$y = 10$$
$$x$$ divides $$y$$ if there exists an integer $$k$$ such that $$y = kx$$
$$x$$ divides $$y$$ if there exists an integer $$k$$ such that $$y = k+1$$
questions.solution: $$x$$ divides $$y$$ if there exists an integer $$k$$ such that $$y = kx$$

questions.question: Give the definition of a prime number.
choices:
question: A prime number is an integer strictly greater than one which is only divisible by one, itself, and itself $$+1$$.
A prime number is an integer strictly greater than one which is only divisible by itself.
A prime number is an integer strictly greater than one which is only divisible by one and itself.
A prime number is an integer strictly greater than one which is only divisible by one.
questions.solution: A prime number is an integer strictly greater than one which is only divisible by one and itelf.

questions.question: Give the definition of an irrational number.
choices:
question: An irrational number is a imaginary number which is not rational.
An irrational number is a real number which is not rational.
An irrational number is a real number which is rational.
An irrational number is a real number which is divisible by some number $$n$$ in $$\mathbb{N}$$.
questions.solution: An irrational number is a real number which is not rational.
